isis.stitle: TSI 92-11-01 - Clutch Adjustment of Rockwell and Eaton Valeo Clutches

subjectgroup.subject: Clutch Adjustment of Rockwell and Eaton Valeo Clutches

geninfo.para: This TSI describes the service procedures for clutch adjustment for the Rockwell Clutch codes 11LRA, 11LRB, 11MRA, 11MRB and the Eaton Valeo Clutch codes 11SXD and 11SXE.
Rockwell and Eaton Valeo Clutch Maintenance Manuals are available and should be ordered through the Navistar Fulfillment Center at Westmont, IL.

svcproc.title: CLUTCH ADJUSTMENT - ROCKWELL CLUTCH CODES 11RA, 11LRB, 11MRA AND 11MRB

svcprocinfo.para: The clutch should be adjusted when the following occur:

item.para: The clutch is removed or replaced.
Any component of the clutch linkage is serviced.
The free travel of the clutch pedal is less than 1/2 inch (13mm).

svcprocinfo.para: Before the clutch is adjusted check the following:

item.para: The clutch system is in good condition.
Linkage is tight and moves freely during operation.

There is no 'false' free travel. Keep the clutch lever from moving and depress the clutch pedal. If the pedal moves more than 1/2 inch (13mm), 'false' free travel is in the linkage. Inspect the linkage and all pivot points for wear or damage. Service as necessary.
The release fork moves when the clutch pedal is depressed.

important.para: Adjust the release bearing clearance before doing any other adjusting.

step1.para: Remove cover for the inspection hole of the clutch housing.
Check the release bearing clearance as follows:

item.para: Measure the distance between the rear face of the release bearing and the clutch brake ( Figure 1).
The distance between the rear face of the release bearing and the brake must be 1/2 inch (13mm) (Item 4, Figure 1). If the distance is not 1/2 inch, go to Adjust the Clutch.

step1.para: A 1/2 inch Gauge Tool (Item 3, Figure 1) for non-synchronized transmissions is available from Snap-on® Tools. The Snap-on part number is SP2003. The tool can also be made locally.

item.para: Measure the distance between the front of the release bearing and the clutch cover ( Figure 2).
The distance between the frontof the release bearing and the clutch cover must be 11/16 inch (17mm) (Item 3, Figure 2). If the distance is not 11/16 inch, go to Adjust the Clutch.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Release Bearing Clearance - Non-Synchronized Transmission
Figure 2. Release Bearing Clearance - Synchronized Transmission

step1.para: Push the clutch pedal to bottom of pedal travel several times to make sure the release bearing housing is in the correct position. Use another person or a block of wood to hold the pedal at the bottom of the travel. Hold the pedal in this position when the adjusting ring is moved.

note.para: Do not use the starter to move the flywheel. Rotate the crankshaft with the correct size socket on the front pulley. If the front pulley is difficult to turn, use a spanner wrench on the teeth of the flywheel to move the flywheel.

step1.para: Move the flywheel so that the lock plate is seen through the inspection cover ( Figure 3).
Remove the capscrews and lock washers that fasten the lock plate to the clutch cover. Remove the lock plate ( Figure 3).

Rotate the adjusting ring to obtain the specified clearance of the release bearing. Use a screwdriver or an adjusting tool as a lever against the notches on the ring to move the adjusting ring. When the adjusting ring is moved one notch, the release bearing will move .023 inch (0.59mm) ( Figure 4).

note.para: An adjusting tool is available from International Service Parts. The part number is ZTOEM 6464.
The clutch pedal must be released to check the release bearing clearance.

step1.para: Recheck the release bearing clearance (with gauge tool). See step 2 (Check release bearing clearance). Re-adjust if not within specifications, see Adjust the Clutch.
Install the lock plate. Install and tighten the capscrew that fastens the lock plate to the clutch cover.

Check the clearance between the tips of the release fork and the bosses on the release bearing ( Figure 5). The distance must be 1/8 inch (3mm). If the distance is not 1/8 inch, adjust the clutch linkage. Refer to GROUP 11 in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for clutch linkage adjustment information.
Install the cover for the inspection hole. Install and tighten the capscrews.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Check Release Fork For Clearance

svcproc.title: CLUTCH ADJUSTMENT - EATON VALEO CLUTCH CODES 11SXD AND 11SXE

step1.para: Disconnect the external linkage to allow for free movement of the release yoke.

Loosen the locknut ring and rotate sleeve with adjusting ring to gain proper release travel clearance. On units with a clutch brake, this distance is 1/2 inch (Item 3, Figure 6). On units without a clutch brake, this distance is 3/4 inch (Item 1, Figure 6).
Tighten the locknut ring against the release bearing coupler.
Reconnect the external linkage and adjust to obtain 1/8 inch (Item 4, Figure 6) clearance between the yoke fingers and the bearing pads.

Verify a clutch pedal free-travel of at least 1-1/2 inches. If less, re-adjust the external linkage to obtain 1-1/2 inches of pedal free-travel. This will slightly increase the 1/8 inch yoke finger clearance.

important.para: If no free play is present in the linkage, clutch may not engage fully and will slip.
